column1: Little Goat Diner////I'd come back to Little Goat as everything which I saw coming out of the kitchen made me second guess my order. Our meal was on the heavy side
column2: which given the very warm day wasn't the best pairing. However
column4: this would really hit the spot. Welcoming atmosphere
column6: friendly staff and a diverse crowd dining around us. Food was great
column7: too. My Rueben had wonderfully crispy pastrami and the kimchee was a creative twist. The onion rings were made with pickled onions which really set them apart from any that I'd had before. Best of all was the price. Two drinks
column8: two meals and an appetizer for less than $70.
